Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and great location.”
Reviews.Author: MajesticSeacow
Reviews.Content: We read a fair few reviews before booking this hotel, and decided to book based on a review below which said 'great if you don't moan every 5 minutes!'. This couldn't be more true. It always surprises me that people expect 5* hotels when they are clearly - and honestly - advertised as less! I don't go to Mc Donalds for rump steak and champagne. This is a 2* hotel and for your money, you get a 2* hotel. We were expecting something clean and basic and were actually overwhelmed by the quality of room we got. We had a lovely corner room with balconies overlooking the plaza and the street. The bed linen was clean, crisp and changed daily. The bathroom was big, clean and modern. The staff went out of their way to help us settle in Barcelona and were quick to help us find nice restaurants and bars. The breakfast was colossal, bearing in mind the price we paid. I was thrilled with the quality. We weren't blessed with good weather during our stay so we didn't need to open the windows at night, however, if we had, we would have expected traffic noise bearing in mind that the hotel sits on a road which leads to the Placa de Catalunya - one of the busiest intersections in the city. Staying in the centre of European cities usually is quite noisy - that's the nature of city living. You can't have your cake and eat it, if you want to be near the big attractions in Barcelona! So, in a nutshell, it's the the same story as in most in busy European cities: if you don't want to spend a fortune, you are happy to stay amongst the hustle and bustle near all the major attractions, in somewhere basic and clean - this hotel is perfect. If you want a silent night's sleep and full cooked breakfast every morning, then it's perhaps best to pay a bit more and stay outside the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, smelly and expensive”
Reviews.Author: ignacio_valdecasas
Reviews.Content: I've recently had to stay in Hotel Condestable for three nights, so had time to experience their service enough. Location is certainly excellent, something to value. However, the price was certainly very high to the quality of the room. Very very small the one-bed room, There wasn't even space to fit my small suitcase on the floor! It did have breakfast, with toasts, juice, some fruit, coffee and ham&chesse. Nothing espectacular. The clean issue. The wall had boogers! the toilet had urine spits on it and the worktop in the toilet was sticky and never cleaned!I could not believe that! Furthermore, my room had a very strange smell, which they told me it was due to a problem they had that they. The smell didn't leave during my stay and it smelled like a kitchen. I couldn't even open the window, which connected to a small inside counteryard with no natural light. definitively I'm not thinking in coming back there.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ANISH P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: la ramala was five minutes away, tube station outside. airport bus stops out side. night bus 17 goes out the hotel to the airport. very good. worth the money. tour bus stand is 5 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good accept breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SemaTyk
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Not too noisy(from outside), but you need luck with neighbors- internal acoustic is fantastic! 24h shop 3m from hotel. OK for families and friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel in the heart of barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Scrantastic
Reviews.Content: The hotel condestable is super located. If you take the bus from the airport, get out at plaza universitat an dyou are 1 minute from the hotel. The hotel is ok, a little bit pricy (i went there during the cellphone fair so maybewhy the price was higher). For me it worth maximum of 80 euros per night not more.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: oladunk123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three and it's one of the most disappointing hotels I stayed at so far. Although not too much can be expected from a 2-star hotel. The locations for this hotel is quite good, just a short walk from Plaza Catalunya/La Rambla and short distance to the L1 metro line. Beds are made and new towels every day. I did not have their breakfast, there's too many lovely local places to eat. Done with the good, over to the bad. The noise from the street isn't too bad, but it's a fair bit of traffic there all day and night and if you're sensitive to sound or need fresh air while sleeping, you may want to look elsewhere. Also, the walls are very thin and sound travels easily from other rooms. The beds are rock hard, room is small and bathroom even smaller. Cleaning is horrible, the rooms are dirty in all but the most visible places. They advertise free WiFi, but their WiFi is so poor it's impossible to access properly most of the time and I was never able to for more than 5 seconds in my room and when I let them know of the problem they just shrugged and said they know it's a problem but nothing is to be done, and directed me to an internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “condestable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: They were really kindly. The hotel room was average and had seen better times but the location is great and service was very friendly. Would go again. It s a bit noisy, mostly from the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: farrahmu
Reviews.Content: I went over the weekend of Feb 10-12, 2012. Given the location of the hotel (which is magnificent by the way), I thought this hotel would be annoyingly noisy at night but having an inward facing room, it was dead quiet from the outside hustle and bustle... however, the walls are extremely paper thin so you can hear EVERYTHING that is going on in the rooms surrounding you, down the halls etc... so I blame the other hotel guests on my lack of sleep. The room wasn't entirely sealed i.e. the door to my room had gaps which you could peer to the hall way - not massive holes but noticeable gaps. I wedged a towel along the bottom and up the side of the door to drown out the hall lights at night but unfortunately, nothing could keep out the sound. It was very very clean which was impressive, the rooms were basic in terms of amenities - you get what you pay for. You did need to let the hot water run for a good 5 minutes before it was warm enough to have a shower.

Reviews.Title: “great location . nice place to stay if you dont moan every 2 mins”
Reviews.Author: reddevilChesterfield
Reviews.Content: Basically the condestable is a great place to stay if your just using it as somewhere to get your head down , We found the guys on the reception ok and trustworthy , the breakfast we didnt bother with so cant comment.. The rooms were ok for what we wanted but if your wanting 5 star then you really should be paying 5 star money.. The location is the best thing about this hotel and has a great tapas restaurant just over the road which we used new years eve and found it to be very reasonable. 5 mins walk to las ramblas and the plaza de catalunya ... Airport bus stops right outside the hotel and costs 5 euros 75 cents per person each way... its a 30 min walk to le segrada familia 30 mins down ramblas to beach all at a slow pace of course because there that much to see.. We found the best way to get around was the tube its so easy to use and costs e12.50.. this was unlimited use for 2 days and we made this really pay for us.. Overall a great holiday and i would go back tomorrow. Hope my review helps someone byeeeeeee

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: PrestonMcCormick
Reviews.Content: Needed a room in Barcelona with easy access to the Renfe train station at Playa de Catalunya, this hotel situation is perfect, a 3 minute walk to the train station and Les Ramblas. Rooms basic but clean and staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tina778
Reviews.Content: The Location of this hotel is it main selling point but unfortunatly that is the only good point. Clean room however the walls are paper thin, If the person next door flushes their loo, you will hear it. Breakfast, also not great - dry bread /croisants etc. You are better of getting breakfast outside. Not too expensive and much fresher (just walk a little further than the restuarants around the corner of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, Barcelona centre”
Reviews.Author: Willgo23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights mid September. It's a good 2 *hotel, the reception folks are very helpful and I was allocated room 404 on the top floor with a good view of University Place. The owner has gradually improved the hotel over the past 2 years and has flat screen TV's in the rooms. You will be aware of traffic noise, the room was clean and the bed was comfy, but the walls between rooms are thin with no sound proofing. You can hear conversation and much more besides from the adjacent room's so you have been warned!! One night the resident in room 405 had his TV volume up loud until 12:00 so I phoned reception and they immediately solved the difficulty. Breakfast is the usual continental buffet fare and is located in a basic dining (canteen like) room on floor 2 and was busy every morning; I found the breakfast was enough to get me started each day. There are lots of restaurants and cafes in the immediate area and I particularly liked the Hidleberg next door. You are adjacent to University stop for the metro, which is the cheapest way to get around the city (10 journey ticket is 8.50 Euros) and you are just 5 minutes walk from las Ramblas, shopping, the old quarter etc.

Reviews.Title: “a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: monica r
Reviews.Content: This little gem is worth much more than 2 stars. Compact, clean room with double bed, wifi that works, a balcony, bath, good breakfast, good location and aircon. Very good value. Take the aerobus from the airport and get dropped off right across the road, then walk to the Rambla or head out for tapas, shopping or culture. It's easy to explore Barcelona from this little find.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghStillroamin Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Needed a night in Barcelona as had to catch a flight the next morning and wouldn't have made it from where we stayed down the coast. Only looking for a cheap hotel which was central where we could se a bit and get a nice meal nearby. This hotel didn't disappoint. Right at the top on La Ramblas, the tour buses stop outside, the airport bus stops outside and the metro was opposite so no problem getting about. The room was very small especially with the extra bed we needed but very clean and quite modern. The breakfast was ordinary but fine . Would stay again but wouldn't recommend for 3 if staying longer than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, no frills accomodation in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GingeEnTonic
Reviews.Content: All staff were very friendly and provided a great service. They answered any questions we had very well. The rooms were basic, the bathroom had new decor, and they were immaculate. The position of the hotel is right by Placa de Catalunya where all the open top busses start, there's lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. I would only say that if you are a light sleeper you may find being on the edge of a busy road a problem. We had breakfast included which had hot drinks, orange juice, yogurts, toast, cheese, salami, croissants and cakes and some cereals. I thought for the money we spent we got an excellent experience and hotel and I would definitely return there should I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money. Save and get a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: f_cembrola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the metro. This is the only positive point about this hotel. The beds are terrible. We could feel the spings of mastresses into our backs. There is very poor sound insulation. We could hear noises from the street (all night) and noises from the stairs (people coming and going). The brekfast is OK regarding quality, but the choice is very limited and always the same. Regards Francesco C

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stella911
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overall an "Okay" place to stay. All shops, restaurants and internet cafe's are not far away at all they are only around the corner and we all recommend a restaurant called "Cent Fox" which was only a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The food was absolutely delicious a 3 course meal was only 8 EURO which is about $15 AUD - what great value! The concierge was a bit arragant at first.The service wasn't bad...we asked for a few things such as blankets and pillows and then had to call up the concierge and re-inforce what we asked. When we went to have a shower we had to call somebody to help us with our water as it was not warm because everybody was using the hot water at the same time so we had to wait but then the man fixed it and he was very helpful. Overall a great experience and we give this hotel a 3/5

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveLSheffield Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were a party of two senior couples. The hotel was nicely located close to many of the 'must see sights'. It was clean and warm. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms, although small, were adequate and satisfied our needs. The breakfast just about covered everyone's dietary needs and there was plenty of it. If you are looking for swimming pools,spas and gyms you should look elsewhere. This is a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ErinandTony
Reviews.Content: First of all, when I booked this hotel room the terms and conditions I agreed to stated that a deposit would be charged to my credit card. The deposit was charged and the next week the entire stay was also charged. I contacted the booking company (I booked on the direct hotel website) and I had to follow up several times and still did not receive a response. Poor customer service! The check in process at the hotel was also very strange - they gave us keys to the room without really checking us in and I was not given a receipt for the charge until the next day. The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic. It is directly across the street from a metro station and is about a 5 minute walk to the top of Las Ramblas. There are great bars right within the same building (just around the corner). However - this is the LOUDEST hotel I have ever stayed in. The walls are paper thin and you can hear every noise. The neighbors next to us sounded like they were directly in our room. In fact, we had a conversation with them the next morning from our bed (no kidding) I didn't have one night of sleep. Also, the mattresses are horrendous. They are super thin and the springs are poking out. No restful sleep here. Also, the front desk staff is not very pleasant or welcoming. Overall, I suggest spending a few extra dollars and staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “unfair ! bad hotel in barcelona !”
Reviews.Author: siegfried357
Reviews.Content: I booked and payed (with Visa) a double room for 2 nights (180Eu). Twelve days before our stay my wife had to undergo urgent surgery, so I immediate cancelled the room. Ever since I try to recover my 180Eu. They never answer my many e-mails. This is unfair: if you cancel 12 days before, they must refund you. I have medical proof from the hospital. This is stealing. Do not stay at the Hotel Condestable !

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault this value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: gegg
Reviews.Content: Smack bang in the centre of Barcelona this hotel all be it a basic hotel gives you very good value for money. Rooms were clean with fresh linen every day, staff were polite, breakfast was a bit on the boaring side but good enough....Ham, Cheese, boiled eggs, sugarpuffs, fruit, coffee, orange juice, you get the picture....Cold buffet sort of thing. As i said smack bang in the centre. metro across the road (easy to use) We went to see Barcelona v Espanyol (football match) unbelivable, had a great 3 days at the hotel cant fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, small bed, noise wasn't a problem and would recommend if only looking for a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: irishstudentadvisor
Reviews.Content: Only an 8 minute walk from La Rambla, the Port and directly beside numerous shops, bars, restaurants and the Metro Station. Fantastic location. I've read numerous complaints about the noise, but our room was away from the street so it was not a problem. I travelled with 3 other friends and we all stayed in the same room. 2 of the beds were clearly just added in for our stay. I am 5'5" and found the bed only just fitted me. Bathroom was perfect, the room was spacious, a safe was in the wardrobe and the key was provided at reception for free. There is a luggage room but I would be careful leaving valuables there as the room was unguarded and left open. We walked in and out a few times during our last day without anyone stopping us. We booked by Visa and discovered on arrival that they had taken the entire bill from our account straightaway prior to even seeing the room. We did not pay the €8 for breakfast as there were tons of cheap alternatives right beside the hotel. Great place for us, who only wanted somewhere to sleep as there is so much to do in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A short couple got a fine tiny room in centrally-located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ruthgree
Reviews.Content: Condestable was a great spot to visit all parts of Barcelona from, across the street from the subway. Given the very low price, it was worth it. Our room was tiny, but who needs floorspace when you're with the one you love?

Reviews.Title: “It's not the ritz but great location!”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandBigbird
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the condestable for 3 nights with great trepedation having read previos reviews.my conclusion is that i should really stop reading reviews as i think people are far too picky.At the price which was £190 for bed and breakfast for both of us you couldn't go wrong.Barcelona is an expensive city aftreall.On a city break if you spent too much time in the hotel then somethings wrong. Room is basic but spotless and is cleaned every day with fresh towels shower gel etc which i did'nt expect for a 2 star.encountered a few different guys on reception (which is 24 hr)and all where really pleasant.Breakfast is again pretty basic but plentiful as has been said.enough to set you up for the day. Location really is perfect.there is a metro stop right across the street.numerous bus stops etc and 5 minutes to Pl Cataluyna and La rambla.plenty of bars and restaurants nearby.From the airport there is a blue airbus that will drop you off at pl catalunya and it's a straight walk up Ronda Universitat,hotel is at the top. Group of students staying at the time who were noisy and yes the walls are thin however for us we needed the break that much and with a glass of wine before bed in the bar around the corner we were fine! In short it is what it is but is without a doubt clean and handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Loulabelle2008
Reviews.Content: Amazing location (2 blocks from placa catalunia), staff were friendly. We had apartment 1 which was amazing - modern, clean and spacious. Will definately be going back - great value for money for being so central.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1232
Reviews.Content: I am not one to usually write reviews, but this hotel needs to come with a warning. This was my fourth time in Barcelona. Our travel agent booked this hotel, so I didn't do my usual research. When I first read that the hotel was noisy, I didn't think much of it because european streets usually are noisy. However, this was horrible. As someone else explained, you could hear every peep from all the rooms around you. So much so, that it was even uncomfortable to talk because it was not private. What's worse, is that there were a group of young males who literally yelled and screamed (celebrated) for two nights in a row until 2am. They sang and slammed doors, stomped on floors and hit walls. it echoed through the entire hotel and you could tell the other guests were upset....but the staff did nothing!! We got not sleep for the entire time. The ceiling leaked every day and dripped on my bed. The toilet stopped working, and when they say hairdryer in every room, they mean that you have to go down to the desk every morning and borrow it. The beds were so short, that my feet hung off..I'm only 5'8". I could go on, but I just wanted to warn people that this is a horrible, horrible hotel, that is more akin to a Hostel. Avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishJayhawk98
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in March 2008 through Venere. The night we arrived in Barcelona it was pouring rain and there was a strike going on that shut down the streets by Placa Catalunya. My husband and I had to walk over a mile in the rain to the hotel with our luggage. Upon arriving at Condestable and giving them my last name, they confirmed by telling me my first name. We were then informed that the website we had booked through had changed our reservation to another hotel. We knew this wasn't true as I had just checked my email. The person behind the desk told us we had to go to another hotel near Plaza Espana, which was no where near where we wanted to stay. We had picked Condestable based on its location and price. We explained to the man that the streets were closed and that we had just walked in the rain, but got nowhere with him. Although we can't be sure, the "full" sign on the door indicated to us that our room was given away to someone else that was willing to pay more. We told the man at the desk that we would not be staying at the other hotel and left. We found a room at the Hotel Jazz down the street, which ended up costing us $120 more than Condestable would have cost, but the room was nice and clean and the people at the front desk were very friendly. Upon arriving home and looking at our credit card bill, we ended up being charged for a nights stay at the other hotel where Condestable moved our reservation. After several emails with this hotel, the charges were credited to our account. It was very upsetting that Condestable was giving out our credit card information to another hotel without our permission. Do not book here. They do not honor reservations!!

Reviews.Title: “"great location" but!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katep123456
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 11pm, check in went smoothly. got to our room, (a triple) first impressions ok clean and 3 single beds. got into bed and this is when the problems started. walls so thin and i mean paper thin you can hear entire conversations any tiny noise is amplified due to tiled floors everywhere. pillows terrible very well used and thin asked reception for another pillow answer no. want a lie in. forget it the cleaners so noisy slamming doors etc. went to breakfast this was okay. buffet style meat cheese jam yoghurt tea coffee juice. not bad tho it is a self clear away service too! (advice don't eat the croissants grim!!) check out ok. although no help with luggage men just stood around and watched my Gran and mother in law struggle around them!! on a positive note the location is just 5 mins away from the plaza de catalunya and la rambla. question: would i stay there again? no way!! and very expensive for a 2star. over £100 per night inc breakie.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HHHYYY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Easy access to everywhere. Metro, Universitat is right across from the hotel, Bus stop is just outside. Only 5-6min walk to Placa Catalunya. Easy walk from Airport bus stop at Catalunya. Ramblas, Pg. Gracia, Gotico area are also close by. Fairly safe to be out even at night. Many shops and bars and tapas close by. One of reception staff, Juan was very kind and helpful to suggest where to eat local food. Speaks excellent English. But room (we had twin room) was a bit noisy. weird water sound (I think) from upstairs scared us at night & early morning. No key for big windows at balcony. (we were on 4th floor so didn't worry too much) Bathroom had sewer smell. shower was decent. enough hot water. Mattress was not that comfortable but ok. You don't expect much from 2 star hotels right? Breakfast was ok. OJ, coffee/tea, Milk, Rolls(jam and butter), cheese, ham, boiled eggs, yogurt., and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, good location, but in the middle of the traffic”
Reviews.Author: Tjasa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good position, because is in the center and near metro station. But if you are looking for paceful hotel, this is not the right one, because it is situated in the middle of two major streets (be carefull). Otherwise everything is fine for a 2 star hotel. The rooms are small, but for 2 - 3 days it is O.K. If you are looking for a romantic place, better to select another one.

Reviews.Title: “Location! View!”
Reviews.Author: PondCrosser
Reviews.Content: Great location, and excellent room! The location was perfect, and safe! As soon as we got off the train from the airport we saw a pickpocket nab someone! Well, we expect these things to happen, but we were concerned. Felt very safe in Barca after we settled in. The location allowed you to walk La Ramble to the water, and walked around the local area. View from room made up for the small size of room (and bathroom). Construction going on, didn't phase us. It was a 'simple' room, but waking up and looking out TWO doors to the streets was amazing! Staff was super friendly! There is a great bar around the corner, very small, played jazzy/rock music. Good place to chill. Grabbed a bottle of wine and sat in room one night, like own personal cafe without annoying men/expensive drinks :) The view was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: spock1701
Reviews.Content: Barcelona Hotel Condestable-Great location Date 22Nov07 Booked 5nights package,flights/accom,with Flyglobespan from Glasgow. The hotel was very clean,towels/linen changed daily.Rooms are small but all you need for a city break.if this is classed as 2*then I am very impressed.Breakfast was included in the price & was basic but served it's purpose-rolls/conflakes etc & plenty of coffee. Staff had a good understanding of english & we found them very helpful,particularly as regards the best way by bus to the Camp Nou! The aerobus from the airport drops you at Placa Catalunya if you miss the Universtat stop like we did,but you are only a few minutes walk to the hotel& you pick it up at Placa Catalunya to go backto the airport. The location is great -Las Rambles is directly of Placa Catalunya& it takes you down to the marina/harbour/beach all within walking distance.We only used the bus to go to the game ,but the transport system in general is very good. The Aquarium & Maritime museum are worth a visit. Eating out is not a problem plenty of variety we found Divinus just down the road from the hotel very good with an english menu available.

Reviews.Title: “Well worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Maroulla
Reviews.Content: Good hotel no problems at all. Thought we were getting a small room with 4 beds but got a whole suite which for us as a family was fantastic. Only downside was the noise! hotel is surrounded by main roads and we had the room with the bar next door which had a tv on the shared wall which was only a partition wall. The location was fantastic literally a few minutes walk from Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. Bus from the airport drops you at Placa Universitat which is next to the hotel. Would reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Cockroach Named Albert”
Reviews.Author: FirstTimetoEurope
Reviews.Content: You know something is wrong when you are worried that you might catch lice or something... or have cockroaches crawl on you just from sleeping in the bed. This was a new worry for me... is this common to Barcelona hotels? I don't know. What I do know is that at the Condestable we found a cockroach (we named it Albert... an attempt to try to get a laugh out of our horror and disgust, we were on vacation after all) in our room (their solution was to come up and spray it with Raid) and it smelled like urine... like, that smell that you get in the stairwells of parking garages where someone has urinated in a corner. The Raid made it smell sooo much better. I wish I was exaggerating. This smell didn't become apparent until the second day, though... we think they may have put air freshener in the room the first day and it wore off. The worst hotel we stayed in on our 3 week trip to Europe. To be fair, we did have a great location by the Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. They did have a complaint form which we never filled out... what is the point? It didn't feel like one of those places that it mattered a whole lot... we just threw in the towel. We literally celebrated when we moved on to our next city and came to the Ibis hotels, which seemed like heaven after this ordeal. It gave us a story to tell though!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: jamarissa
Reviews.Content: 4 girlies went to celebrate a 21st birthday, the staff were friendly, the price was excellent and the room was super cute as had 4 bed in one, great to stay if you want to see barcelona, not for a luxury break. great location near bus tours all the shops in las ramblas, opposite metro st and felt completly safe. wouldnt bother getting the breakfast for 8 euros, doesnt work out good value.

Reviews.Title: “Condestable!”
Reviews.Author: jules68
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to discover I had put in the wrong date on the computor! Reception staff were quick to say they had rooms available, so we were quite relieved. But it was soon obvious we had what was left over(room 324) , and I suppose begars can't be choosers but it has to be the worst maintained room I have ever stayed in - tiles missing in bathroom, sink glued back together, stained and broken polystyrene ceiling tiles, etc. As other reviewers have said the walls are very thin and the traffic noise is loud and on this advise we took ear plugs! But I must add that on walking past a room that was being cleaned that it had a very modern bathroom so all rooms are not the same! The plus sides were that the bed sheets were clean and the location was handy for using the airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , very noisy , small rooms”
Reviews.Author: danmcx
Reviews.Content: - Friendly english speaking staff ! - Clean room, but very very small - Extremely noisy - 15m away from the subway station Universidad , and 5 minute walk (400m) from the Placa Catalunya , you can take the Aerobus from the airport and drops you in Placa Catalunya - We had a room looking into the .. backyard or something, we couldn't see well because the balcony room was broken and we couldn't open it, however, we didn't asked for another room because we were gone most of the time. - Powerfull air conditioning unit - Nice bathrooms I'd stay again if I ever return to BCN, it's a good hotel for budget travellers

Reviews.Title: “walls too thin”
Reviews.Author: littlemissgamble
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were really helpful and friendly and one of the receptionists rang around to get a cheap minibus to go to the airport for our return journey. The hotel was in a really good location and it was so cheap you get what you pay for. Very clean too. The downside - the noise from other guests. The walls were simply too thin and you could hear everything. I wore wax earplugs for bed and was still woken up around 4am by other guests leaving their rooms, they weren't noisy, just talking normally but it drove me nuts and I have returned home absolutely shattered because I got very little sleep. Barcelona was fabulous though and next time I would spend more money on a hotel with better sound proofing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: roxy85
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel!the room is clean ,the staffs speak english and very friendly and helpful(they carried our luggage without having to ask).the metro is just opposite the hotel and most importantly this hotel is located in the heart of barcelona which is just less than 5 minutes walk to catalunya and the famous la rambla and also el cortes ingles.restaurants are everywhere!.i would definitely stay here again!muy bien!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling7
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days in Barcelona with 8 girlfriends. We choose this hotel for location, and it did not disappoint. A stone throw from La Rambla, and easy to get to by public transport. The hotel is simple, but clean. What set this hotel apart for me is the service we received. The front desk was helpful in giving tips & calling taxis. Above all, they jumped into a taxi to deliver my forgotten passport to the airport at 9am on a Monday morning. I was impressed! Ask for a room with a balcony, but don't forget your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Fun With The Plum”
Reviews.Author: Jinty_O
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of November. After getting the aerobus from the airport (very cheap - 3.25 euros) we had a little trouble finding the hotel even though it is only a 2 minute walk round the corner from where we got off the bus. We were allocated a room (338 - BEWARE!!!) which had a tiny window looking into some sort of shaft. The room was getting absolutely no air and the heat was almost unbearable. I requested an outer room with a window but had to wait til the following morning as all were occupied. The next morning I was given another room with a balcony overlooking the university almost immediately and moved straight in after it was cleaned. WHAT A RELIEF!!! I found the breakfast basic but tasty. Im quite a simple (i.e. fussy) eater at the best of times so i enjoyed the breakfast. The staff in the dining room were quite surly but we found everyone else to be very helpful and pleasant and the rooms were absolutely spotless. Overall we had a great time and can't wait to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JHPHOTO
Reviews.Content: Great location for wandering about the city centre. Very pleasant and helpfull staff. Room spotlessly clean.Considering we paid less than £100 for two nights ( including flights from Glasgow) for this Hotel it could not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong floor?”
Reviews.Author: Fess111
Reviews.Content: Linen spotless, room dirty. The reception staff and cleaners were very pleasant. Location good but a lot of traffic noise. Would not stay there again. After reading other reviews about it being basic but clean I think I must have got the lazy maids floor as clean it was not. It was cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: tokalot
Reviews.Content: Twin room was very small and had no window which made it a bit claustrophobic but it was spottlessly clean. Found it a touch too hot at night which wasn't very good for two menopausal women! Breakfast was a non starter and breakfast staff were surly.If you're looking for budget accommodation in a good location this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: dct_toronto
Reviews.Content: air conditioners make a strange noise every few minutes, interrupting your sleep, very small rooms, we saw 3 LARGE cockroaches in the hallway off the lobby upon arrival...the maid was calling for help from a young man who sprayed them to death, then she swept them up in front of us. I would NEVER stay here again and would encourage everyone else to STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but brilliant”
Reviews.Author: flo12
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Skymax1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fine choice if you want to stay in the core of the city (near the major attractions: the rambla , gaudi's houses, biggest stores) with a modest budget. The Subway is just across the road and a few stops from the sea, the Sagrada famiglia and the Ciudadela Park. We stayed in a double room and it was not too big, but it was cleaned daily. Satellite TV for the major languages was available (Italian too). Breakfast was optional (7 Euro each person), but we never tried it. The hotel people was kind. During this period there are works in progress and the facade is covered with scaffolds, but this has not been a problem for us.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Condestable
HotelInfo.Address: Ronda Universidad 1, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
